headline.main: Arrival of the Moses Taylor and St. Louis.; DEPARTURE OF SANTA ANNA FOR HAVANA, Bombardment and Capture of the Peruvian Port of Arica. THE TRANSIT TO REMAIN CLOSED Probable Adjustment of the Troubles Between Nicaragua anti Costa Rica. No-Ratification of the Yrissari Treaty. Probability of the Ratification of the Cass-Harran Treaty. $1,403,949 in Treasure. TWO WEEKS LATER FROM CALIFORNIA. Abandoment of the Colorado Explorating Expedition. President Ospina on Relations with the United States. OPENING OF THE NEW-GRANADIAN CONGRESS. Interesting from Central and South America.

docs.abstract: murder of his family and himself
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Moses Taylor, JOHN MCGOWAN, Esq., commanding, from Aspinwall on the 18th inst. at 5 o'clock P. M. arrived at this port yesterday morning. The Moses Taylor brings the California mails of the 5th inst., and passengers brought down from San Francisco by the Pacific Mail steamship Golden Age.

docs.lead_paragraph: Letter from Col. Johnston, Detailiag the Difficulties Encountered - Temper of the Mermons, c. From the St. Louis Republican, March 23. We have perused a letter from Col. JOHNSTON to a friend in this city, dated at Camp Scott, Feb, 5, 1858, and have been permitted to make some extracts there from.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; POL.ICE COMMISSIONERS. The Recorder's Office--The Kidnapping Case The Parties Held to Bail. Drunkenness in the Force to be Punished with Dismissal -- Foreign Detectives Warned against Abducting Col. All sopp Movement for Obraining from other Cicies Portraits of their Principal Crimihals. City Items. Cunningham not Admitted to Bail--Application for his Release to be made to the Supreme Court. The Greenwich-stree Murder--The Case of O' Connell. THE PAUDEEN HOMICIDE. Letter from Johnny Lyng. FUGITIVE FROM JUSTICE. DESCENT ON A DISORDERLY HOUSE. A YOUTHFUL CULPRIT. Police Intelligence.

docs.abstract: Sentence commuted to imprisonment for life
docs.lead_paragraph: The Commissioners of Metropolitan Force met yesterday, at 3 P. M., in accordance with the previous adjournment:. All the members of the Board were present. The minutes of the previous meeting were read and approved. The charge against Frederick Mariott, of the Eighth Precinet, Brooklyn, was, on motion of Mr. CHOLWELL, dismissed.

docs.lead_paragraph: Neither the Fulton, duo at this port, nor the Niagara, due at Halifax, had been heard from up to the time of going to press. The former is now in her sixteenth day, and the latter in her thirteenth. The California steamship Moses Taylor is also about due.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; The Vote on Kansas to be Taken in the House on Thursday Next--Probable Result--The Purchase of the Pennsylvania Bank Property, & c. By Telegraph to the New-York Times. Magnetic Telegraphic Co.' Offices... No. 43 Wall on., and 181 Broadway FROM WASHINGTON.

docs.abstract: Exd. by Cong. Committee in ref. to Phila. P.O. site
docs.lead_paragraph: It is the general understanding among the members of the House that the vote will be taken on the Kansas question on Thursday next. It is believed by the opponents of the bill that they will leave seven majority in favor of the proposition made by Mr. CRITTENDEN in the Senate, but there is reason to fear that certain three Republicans will not vote for fear bill even if thus amended.

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times: DEAR SIR: You have doubtless often, when traveling on our railway cars, remarked the ridiculous notion that prevails amongst most passengers as to their right of opening windows, when sealed near them.
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: DEAR SIR: You have doubtless often, when traveling on our railway cars, remarked the ridiculous notion that prevails amongst most passengers as to their right of opening windows, when sealed near them.

docs.snippet: The Committee of the Common Council on Repairs and Supplies have reported adversely to the Mayor's proposition for the erection of a building in the Park to contain the Courts and the Post-Office.

headline.main: Alleged Attempt to Murder--Arrest of a Wife Charged with Poisoning Her Husband.

docs.abstract: chd. with attempting to poison her husband
docs.lead_paragraph: From the Rochester Union. About a month since a poisoning case, said to have occurred in Henrictta, was hinted at in the city papers. The matter has rested until to-day, when an application was made to Police-Justice BARDWELL for a warrant for the arrest of a wife charged with attempting to destroy her husband.
